WorkItem.Description: Trying to edit my rotation in 2.3.21 to a Custom AoE rotation consisting of 2 BB, 2 DS, 1 D&D, 1 IT, 1 PS, 1 DC and 2 RS.  When I close the RotationViewer and go back into it, the window is reverting back to the default Blood rotation.  Is there a Save button I'm missing somewhere, or am I missing something else?

Comments.Message:
Be sure to set the radio button to custom, otherwise it uses one of the pre-set rotations.
It should be automatically changing to custom, but it sounds like that's not working, and I'll try to get that fixed.
Yeah, Custom is being selected, but it's not saving.  And it's not auto-changing to custom when I modify the numbers.
not yet.  I'm working on trying to get rotation code cleaned and fixed up.  So it's in process, just fixed/finished yet.

Actually, now that I've had a chance to play around with the DK changes on the PTR, we may not need a Rotation Editor anymore.  The popular consensus is now that Rune Strike is off the "next melee swing" system and the introduction of Runic Empowerment, we're going Priority-based...

exactly.  So I'm looking at what is currently in DPSDK, what I have as my experimental code for TankDK, and then what other models design is for their ability usage and looking to find a good fit moving forward.  Rather than just fix 1 bug at a time, it should deal w/ a majority of the problems in both DK models.
